intro: Leucothoe eucalyptoides, commonly known as the Australian leatherwood, is a flowering plant native to Australia. It belongs to the Ericaceae family and is characterized by its evergreen foliage and showy, bell-shaped flowers. The plant typically grows in heathlands and forested areas, preferring well-drained soils. Its bark is thick and scaly, and it can reach heights of up to 10 meters. Leucothoe eucalyptoides is valued for its ornamental appeal and ecological importance in supporting local wildlife.
